Topic.Title: Anyone having problems signing into yahoo today?

Message.Msg: I did a few months ago. When I finally "logged" in, it was a phisher who deleted everything I had on a Friday night. Yahoo was able to restore my address's but nothing of what I had saved after 48 hours. That's why those creeps did it on a Friday night when Yahoo is off until Monday. P.S. Message.Title: Yahoo: Buy While Price Multiples Are Attractive
Message.Msg: The price-to-book multiple of Yahoo is 1.53, cheaper than the 2.05 S&P 500 average. Yahoo is also a sum of parts play with non-core assets which can be spun-off or sold to other firms. Investors should consider this value to be especially cheap because it misses internally-developed intellectual property including patents, brands, and trademarks. These are fairly cheap valuation metrics for a firm which has the potential to turn around its operations. There is a lot riding on Marissa Mayer. It looks like she is whole-heartedly trying to change Yahoo by making big changes at the top. Since today's price multiples are reasonable, this will be a good time for investors to buy into this story.

Topic.Title: With all their cash, and returns so little now, MSFT and especially AAPL are foolish not to....

Message.Msg: Maybe you are right and the market cap of the stock is less than the breakup value. But neither Apple nor Microsoft are in the business of buying companies they don´t need just to break them up and sell the parts. And any company that is in that business is only buying under the breakup value. For someone to buy Yahoo the price would need to be low enough to get a reasonable return on the investment, no $26 not even $20 maybe $17 but probably much lower. And as for being a company worth buying for the returns; Return on Equity (ttm): Yahoo 8.81% Microsoft 27.51% Apple 44.32% Google 19.04% AOL 36.89% Netflix 19.42%
